text: Natividad Macho Álvarez (13 December 1928 – 20 August 2017) was a Spanish movie and stage actress better known by the stage name Nati Mistral. She was born in Madrid, Spain. Mistral was known for her movie roles in The Captain's Ship (1947), Gold and Ivory (1947), Currito of the Cross (1949), Service at Sea (1951), Cabaret (1953), Lovers of Toledo (1953), My Street (1960), and in Mis tres amores (1971). She won the National Theater Prize in 1997. Mistral died of complications from a stroke in Madrid on 20 August 2017 at the age of 88. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1928 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from stroke Category:Spanish movie actors Category:Spanish stage actors Category:Actors from Madrid
title: Nati Mistral
